reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, let's talk about Brawlhalla for a sec, shall we?

At first glance it would seem as though it's a PC game going for the style of Smash Bros. On the 10th or so glance, it seems as though it's a PC game going for the style of Smash Bros. But with a few twists that keep it mostly seperate.

First of all is the weapon system. I personally LOVE this mechanic. You start off with your weak melee attacks until you pick up a weapon, displayed on-screen as a generic sprite. When that happens, you get a non-generic weapon. Each character has a combination of two weapons that they can recieve. There's guns, spears, hammers, 1 sword, 2 swords, and a rocket lance. That's right, a rocket lance. Though each weapon is not exclusive to their characters, each character has 2 exclusive moves (1 per weapon) that they can use. Each weapon is VERY nicely balanced, and I'll talk more about that later.

There are also items you can pick up, though variety is sparce. There are spiky balls called Mace-Balls, which you throw at enemies. There are land mines, which you can either throw at your opponent(s) or at the walls and floors. Finally, there are plain ol' bombs that will make you stare in disbelief as you fly off into your doom after some ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• throws one at you.

Online play. I'm a little... eh about the quality of the online play at the moment. On one hand, it's incredible to wreck people online and tell them gg" before having all of them ragequit
hoursPlayed: I have that one in there somewhere) there is a lot of lag sometimes. On one hand
voteText: some matches can be as smooth as offline play
helpfulPercent: on the other hand some can involve unforseen game mehanics such as teleportation and death by "I swear that guy was on the other side of the map .01 seconds ago". Despite this
votesHelpful: the developers have stated repeatedly they are constantly working on improving online play. They have had multiple lag fix patches already and more are to come. So
votesTotal: that'll make the game even better.\n\nOffline play is so fun. There's a tournament mode where you play against CPUs to be the ultimate champion. The CPUs are pretty easy themselves
votesFunny: but the challenge lies in not getting killed while gathering many kills to get a high score. There is a star rating out of 5 you get at the end
commentsCount: with 5 being pretty difficult to acheive (SPOILER: There's a practically impossible rating to get that's above 5 stars... No more hints as to what it is) Also
column16: there's local play where you can play with up to four people using controllers
column17: and one person can use the keyboard or keyboard-mouse. No LAN unfortunately. The last thing is training mode. I won't go too much into detail with this
column18: but imagine Smash Bros' training mode + damage per hit shown
column19: visible hitboxes
column20: and hitstun visibility.\n\nThe balance. Outstanding. Though this could also be a statement as to the lack of variety
column21: you could almost press random in a tournament match and come out the victor with anyone you got. Of course
column22: it's not perfect. But unlike some other games
column23: which have tier lists from SS all the way down to F or even G
column24: Brawlhalla's tier list is more like an SS to A.\n\nWait
column26: Brawlhalla has a competitive community that even now
column28: is over 100 strong. This is when the game isn't publicly available
column29: and there's over 100 people participating in competitive play. Think about that for a moment. As I write this even
column30:
I am procrastinating much needed sleep for a Brawlhalla tournament tommorow.

PROS:
-Great brawler in the style of Smash Bros
-Good offline mode
-Has an online mode
-Near impeccable balance
-Growing competitive community

CONS:
-Online mode can be VERY laggy at times
-I can't beat Raidhyn
-No LAN play
-I can't come close to beating Raidhyn
-A little empty (Probably just a closed beta problem)
-I have to fight Raidhyn in a tournament tommorow
-Many characters are kind of similar

Not sure if PRO or CON:
-Very limited variety on items
-Similar enough to Smash Bros to almost be called a ripoff. Not quite though.
-Raidhyn is a very very good competitive player. Think Ken (the Smash Bros Marth player) in his prime. (I may or may not be biased because I can't beat him.)

OVERALL VERDICT:
9.5/10 game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game makes me angry. It makes me flipping furious. It makes me want to tear my eyes out of their sockets and (providing the house is empty) scream the most vile curse I can dig up from the depths of my mind at the top of my voice. But every time I lose that close game, every time they read my heavy attack with a perfect dodge or a well spaced counter, I know that there is for sure a skill gap between me and that other player.

It's tangible.

Being able to see another player who you are THAT close to beating makes you want to improve because you can just go into the replays, watch what they do, compare it to what you do, and if you are REALLY lucky, get them to train with you (yes of course post-game chats make way for cancer but they also make space for amazing opportunities to improve).

I have only 44 hours, but already thanks to the good part of the community found a way to create a mindset of constant improvement. That's when I see people with hundreds of hours of practice, and feel every single hour of play time that they've had, all the matchups that I haven't even begun to consider, and how they mercilessy slaughter you with hours of additional skill. It is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• glorious.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played a couple quick tournaments against bots.  So far, I really like what I've seen.  Took me less than a half hour to feel like I really had a command of the movement controls.  Will take a little longer to get used to the characters' signature weapons, but it's fun to learn each one.

Some cool design decisions:
* Lots of recovery options, so you can almost always get where you want to go on the stage, but if you get hit, you get hit pretty hard.
* Each character has two weapons available, so you can switch your moveset mid-match (item spawns willing) to try to improve your match-up.

Matches tend to be pretty fast and fun.

It's free, give it a try!  If you like it, play more and possibly give 'em moneys.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm not usually interested in these kinds of games, but if you play it with friends, it's amazing.
For me it really reminds me of Super Smash Bros, which I used to play a long time ago, and having it a very similar style is gr8 since I'm familiar with it.

Being able to play with friends without worrying about random people joining is perfect, and how simple of a game it is makes it gr8 & easy to learn too.
(You can also change the keybinds to make it more comfortable to play)

It's not pay to win eitherYou have a mutual chance of beating anyone as long as you know what you're doing and do it right. (No worry for special perks such as extra lives and health)

However, even with the amount of gamemodes and characters you can choose from in the game, it can be quite boring and repetitive after some time. If friends are playing, not so much since you rarely worry about that, and instead you just wanna beat em and get first, lol.

Many of the game mechanics work incredibly well for a game being in beta. Occasionally it seems as if I had hit my enemy and it didn't work, but that was about 5% of the time, and the other 95% it worked just gr8.

Even if you aren't into games like this, I'd really suggest giving it a shot Epsecially if you have friends to play with, you can create some great moments. I have a sucky Mac and I can even run it and have a ton of fun :)

Just go play it, IT'S FREEEE.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've put way too much time into this game.

With the new integration of the MMR system, the ranked can be offputting for new players. As can the overabundance of spammers and the Hattori Wall you find in Bronze/Silver. As the game grows bigger, lower level players are more common and with that commons salty mofos, because this IS a competetive game and people don't like to lose.

But if you can break past the carcinogens off the low level play, this game is such a great one. The community is, for the most part, amazing. The mechanics are simple and charming, which is appealing to new players, but also many deeper techniques and skills one has to develop to become a good player. The balancing is MILES better than Smash. Every character in Brawlhalla is viable, unlike Smash where only a little bit of the roster is used competetively, due to the simplicity of Brawlhalla's game design.

The devs, all 16 of them, are great. They respond to the community all the time on /r/brawlhalla as well as stream biweekly. The game is such a great one and I'm so happy to see it growing... except for all the salty bois. Take yo gg ez" and put it in the trash with Barraza."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In short: A decent smash bros clone. Early Access.

Gameplay
There are so far 13 characters ('Legends') to choose from, and various skins to acquire. Each character has different damage, attack speed, defense and run speeds. As such characters do feel different -- some are tanky, some are pure glass cannons. At the moment all characters are available to play, this will soon switch to a free rotation with permanent unlocks.

On top of individual stats each can equip 2 types weapons (swords, spears, hammers, pistols). Although the weapons are largely the same no matter who wields them (except the looks) each character has a unique special move per weapon type. Then there are mines, bombs, spiky balls to spice up the match.

In terms of movement you can chain up to 3 jumps, dodge, and wall-jump. Nothing fancy, but the 3 jumps do a lot to ensure you stay on the arena. Look at the screenies -- the arenas are tiny, a few small platforms or a single larger one, few walls to bounce back off. And in a typical smash bros fashion with each damage stage you're sent flying with greater speeds.

So far I had problems connecting to online matches though, couldn't even look for a game because I lost connection to server" every time I tried. I don't know if it's just general server issues or what.

Monetisation
Akin to mobas of the day Brawlhalla monetises skins (character
hoursPlayed: and unlocking characters (with a free rotation). The currency is Mammoth Coints

or $10 depending on the 'leet factor' of the skin and include 2 weapon skins exclusive to the character.

Taunts are $3 or $6 each.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

This game is just not fun.
As someone who has put many hours into this game, I can say for sure that it just gets bad.
First off: when you first get the game, it can be pretty fun and is easy to learn, making it pretty fun to play with a couple friends. Casual play is nice, but nothing special.
Competitive play is different. If you play this game as often as someone like me or possibly more, then you will realize just how bad this game is. Usually you end up facing the same legends over and over again, creating a lack of variety. Also, the light and aerial attacks is shared between weapons, so if characters have the same weapons, they only have three different moves. This creates a lack of distinction between characters and repetitive gameplay. There is almost no variety between characters, as even most heavy attacks are just copy/pasted from other legends. This is my personal opinion although some may not agree: the weapon throwing mechanic is terrible. As you climb the rankings into gold and platinum, you will see more and more people only throwing weapons at you in order to start combos or stun you for a heavy attack. It ends up just being not fun to gift these people, making the game more boring, as you can never seem to get close to these people. Sure, a well times air dodge could work, but the weapon spawn rate is so fast that they can immediately take a weapon and punish the dodge. It does seem creative and sets brawlhalla apart from other fighting games, but ultimately adds to the redundancy of the fighting.
Brawlhalla is a casual game and should not be played for a long time. If you play a lot and climb high, then you will see how bland and boring the game becomes. Now I only play this game as a way to pass the time, like old people play solitaire. That is how boring the game has become for me.
Another huge problem is the community. Higher ranked people are nice and will actually try to help you, but in ranks like gold and silver, almost everyone is a jerk. When you lose, they'll brag and spam a phrase to make fun of you, even if they only beat you by a little. If you win, they'll call you out for spamming or just complain and say you got lucky. It makes for an overall toxic community with players staring out. Brawlhalla is a free game though, so perhaps I should not harshly criticize it. It can be fun for a few hours at most, but the core concepts of the game make for bland, repetitive and clunky gameplay, and the community will just make you mad.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The reason I do not recommend this game is solely due to the matchmaking. I understand this is Early Access, but this is strictly a PvP game. And when a PvP only game has matchmaking this poor it's very difficult for me to recommend it. When you queue up for 1v1 or 2v2 Ranked, whatever system is currently in place does not seem to factor in your MMR. I currently am placed at 130 MMR at the time of this review, and my partner was 120 and we got paired against PEOPLE ON THE TOP 5 WORLDWIDE. This is not a one time occurrence, unless you are playing during peak hours the matchmaking could give a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• less about placing you with people in your skill range. One game I get people who suicide 2/3 of their stock, and the next I get paired with people in the top 5. It's wildly inconsistent and just seems to be a product of lazy development. I am aware this community is small, but I've played games with much smaller communities and have never seen a system this terrible, it waits a total of 30-60seconds before just placing you with anybody regardless of MMR.

inb4 obligatory get good" response: Brawlhalla is a game where you can very quickly 0-100 someone given proper knowledge and timing
date: so pairing against two players who have mastered these mechanics is a really awful learning environment and just discourages me from even wanting to put the time in."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPersonally, I love playing this game with my friends. However, in the interest of progression, I have a few suggestions for development of the game. Now, I'm not an expert or anything, but just consider this the thoughts of a seasoned gamer. First off, I would like too see more work put in to customizing all the characters' movesets, making each one feel more unique. Secondly, the overall movement feels a bit off. Not bad, per se, just off. A brawler needs to be a bit more fast-paced than this one is. The gravity could stand to be a bit more forceful, and a slight increase in character speed couldn't hurt, either. And finally, the maps. Now, I know this is still early access, but a little more variation would be nice. As a suggestion, what about opening map development to steam users, and a ranking system to make the better built maps show up more frequently? All in all, this is a good start, but needs some more love before it will have the kind of replay value that Smash Bros. does. I like this game, and hope the developers read this review.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW:

Brawlhalla wastes no time drawing parallels with popular video game brawler, Super Smash Bros. And the similarities are quite seen. But Brawlhalla manages to distinguish itself with its interesting weapon mechanic and quirky characters.

So far, battles are fun. The moves could maybe be a little more diverse, and feel a little more deliberate: sometimes, I would attack in a direction, but it wouldn't go exactly as I intended it to, or it would all be a general aerial attack instead of an aerial attack in a specific direction. Still, it's pretty cool for a beta.

Online play was bad since there's only a specific server located halfway around the world to me so the lag I experience is so intense. It's so bad that when I press a button, my character doesn't even move.

Still, I can't really demerit a game for something like that. I just hope they create more servers in the future so that everyone internationally can battle each other.

In all, a pretty great looking game so far. I can't wait to see the final product.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The fighters are all very similar - the animations for each attack is the same across all characters, and the speed/defense/attack differences aren't large enough to tell, at least for me. The main difference is looks and the weapons they can get. Controls handle well, although only 3 of the 4 possible directions have unique attacks (up, side, down, no movement), and the one that's a duplicate varies depending on if you're in the air or not and which attack button you're using. The high amount of jumps fighters have mean that a great deal of combat takes place in the air and that killing someone is very difficult.

It's fun to play with others, but the only single player mode is incredibly easy and non-configurable - a series of three 4-character matches.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Brawlhalla is similar to games like Super Smash Bros, Awesomenauts, Etc.

The overall concept of the game is excellent.  It removes a little of the casual feel of other games in it's genre, and I believe it will appeal to more technical gamers.

The characters are all available to play right now while it is in beta, but they will be purchasable with in-game earned gold upon release (I believe), similar to the way you'd buy champions in LoL, Dirty Bomb, and loads of other free to play games.

The characters themselves are pretty cool.  The art style is simple, effective, and in my opinion, beautiful.  Each one has a unique moveset and has 2 weapon pick-ups available for it.  The attacks feel clean and the hitboxes make sense, the dodge cooldown seems perfect to me and longer, skilled fights will make you break out in a sweat.

A few awesome modes, slight character customization, and a very solid 1v1 ranked system are all just toppings on an already delicious cake.

10/10 definitely recommend for any brawler fan.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game... what shall i say about it. 1. IT IS AN EARLY ACCES AND I WILL TREAT IT AS SUCH! Meaning.. i will expect some small problems, but at the same time the amount of polishing I think games should have at beta stage.

Well.. first of all. I did not expect it to be this amazingly fun and addicting.

Graphics: (8/10 compared to other 2d cartoonish games)I always like 2d as much as 3d but from the screenshots and some of the weaker video's of the game it looked as if it was a bit to rough and pixely. However after playing it for a while i can honestly say... it fits the game.

The graphics are very smooth, no weird pixelated stuff, high quality backgrounds and overall it looks good.
There are no graphical options at all except for fullscreen/windowed. However with these graphics and good optimisation... this isnt any problem at all for nowadays microwaves. Ow.. did i say microwaves.. i mean ofcourse.. low-end pc's" :D

Options: (7/10)For this game there aren't to much options needed and to be fully honest... the game does not need more options. However as i do objective reviews i will have to compare it to the optionmenu's of similar games. Subjectively they don't need more options. Objectively other games do have resolution options etc.

Things it has atm: windowed/fullscreen setting
recommended:
a place to see the controlscheme being used (it detects what you use and tells you what controls it has .. for keyboard it even has 2 presets you can adjust)

Controls: (8/10)I use a PS4 controller (did also try both xbox360 and keyboard/keyboard+mouse). Controller is very easy to get used to... characters respond very fast to commands and the buttons make sense. keyboard as in any other fighter game.. takes getting used to for sure.
Unlike some other games its far from unplayable and ive seen people who actually got better when they started using their keyboard when their controller ran out of battery
hoursPlayed:
but i still prefer the feel of a controller.

1 thing i do not fully understand in the default attack direction. When you use a soft or heavy attack without pressing any direction it takes the UP direction as default. I would vote for using right/left (where you are looking at that time) as default attack direction.

Performance: (9.5/10)Almost requires nothing.. played it on a pc without any gpu at all and it still worked amazingly well even with the pc using a built-in graphics chipset that barely plays youtube at times XD Ofcourse there isnt TO much to render anyway ;D
-0.5 for a lack of framerate cap option :D

Now the most important part... gameplay: (9/10)Alot of people compare this to Super Smash Brothers.. and well... they would be correct.
The aircombat is slightly slower
voteText: but aside from that it does feel alot like the great brawlers we all know from the peasant  console race ( dem references)\n\nThere are as of now (Early Acces) a good amount of gameplay options ranging from local co-op
helpfulPercent: custom games with friends
votesHelpful: online games
votesTotal: singleplayer bot tournaments and ofcourse ranked 1v1. With custom games you have some nice stuff to tweak ranging from teambattles to ffa
votesFunny: pointlimits
commentsCount: timelimits
column16: damage%'s and more.\nAlso a practise mode that allows you to practise stuff with hitboxes
column17: damageboxes
column18:
damagenumbers etc. all available.

There are a good amount of legends (aka classes aka heroes aka characters) available. All these legends have a different combination of weapons they can carry/pick up and all have different heavy hit movesets. They also differ in stats so they all have their own strenghts and weaknesses. Atm you xcan customise your characters with 2 things...

1. stances (these can only be used in custom games.. NOT in ranked or online yet.. ) .. these stances all take away/give points to certain stats meaning you can give a legend more speed while taking away damage etc. etc.

2. cosmetics... yes.. there are cosmetics :D ranging from f2p cosmetics that grant you different colors to add to your legends armor to paid cosmetics that can change your armor and weapon skins.

The gameplay itself feels very good. I have done both solo as well as with up to 4 friends and i must say... the gameplay feels addictive.. really addictive. Heavy hits make you feel you really punched someone in the face
column19: soft hits make you feel like a ninja.. smoothly hitting someone hit after hit untill you can finish them off and ofcourse the dodge mechanic which adds a good way to get out of that spot where they just keep ramming on you while you have nowhere to go :D or to setup a good combo.\n\nThis is the first game that makes me want to play solo ranked or other modes by myself... not because it is more fun then with friends.. no
column20:
with friends it is freaking amazing. But still solo ranked has its attractions. Unlike Dota2 or Heroes of the Storm where i could NOT play by myself because it felt like an enormous and draining activity.. in this game i want to play solo ranked because its addictive and fun :D

The cashshop: (9.5/10) ( this point im assuming from open beta that is upcoming..it will become totally f2p then (even atm you can get free keys from almost anywhere anyway though)

This is Dota2 quality f2p.. no.. this is better. With Dota2 you can buy items that have such over-the-top particle effects that it can be distractive. At least here it is all within limits atm.

Its 100% cosmetics
column21: no boosts
column22:
no nothing but cosmetic skins that make you stand out slightly more then anyone else.
If they can keep this system up like this.. this would officially be the most f2p game ive seen in many years and i would wish any other developer would take up this f2p system if they made a similar game.

-0.5 for not adding some very small cosmetics that don't look TO different
column23: but can be bought with ingame currency (alot of it) to atleast give 100% f2p a small thin to differentiate.\n\nCommunity: (9/10)I normally do'nt add this part
column24:
but well.. online brawler? I need to report this :D
The community is great... everyone is amazingly friendly (though if you have an opinion about balancing.. well.. everyone has a totally different one so that can clash :D).

Anyway.. ingame after every match it is the famous "gg's" and "wp's" .. and surprisingly.. it is the same in ranked.
As always in ranked i expect competetiveness.. and with that ALWAYS come ego's depending on that competetiveness. Meaning there will always be people who are NOT happy at all when they lose
column25: however in this game i have not encountered that yet. Every time after a game everyone seems to be satisfied about the match and are very friendly (maybe they can just hide their emotions well).\n\nConclusion:The last ranked match i did a few minutes ago represents this game the best in 1 match. It was a ranked 1v1 against a guy/girl a good amount of ranks higher then me (bronze vs silver) .. (i am really sorry
column26:
but i forgot your name.. you random person :D).

I had the luckiest match of my week and dodged/attacked as ive never done before.
I managed to win just barely (last life and in the red) and i calmed down. My hands were sweating
column27:
my arms trembling and it was such an intense match that a wave of relief just hit me in the face .. still calming down the second surprise hit me.
The other player actually said "well played" ... baffled i returned the conversation with saying i was just really lucky this time. We talked a few lines about how the game went and wished eachother luck and hoped we would see eachother in a ranked matches some other time again.

I would give it a solid 8.5/10 right now
column28: a 9/10 when it goes open beta and a 9.5/10 if they add all the features on the storepage.\n\nYou better find a betakey or buy a founder pack i would say (good value)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I haven't really had a good play of this game but from what Iv'e seen so far is that this game definitely has a good concept. It feels like the super smash bros we all know and love and yet with a difference; the movesets are more basic and this game has more of a focus on timing.

Pros and Cons (My opinion):

PROS-
.Smooth controls that work with ease
.Ever increasing character rosters each with their own unique stats
.Smooth and pretty graphics
.Multi-player, local and online, so you can bash your friends where ever they are
.Free (always a good thing)

Cons-
.Sometimes there are minor connection errors and you'll disappear
.The head switching in the top right annoyed me a little(not really a con)
.Not a large amount of items to use(This'll probably be added later though)
.I didn't see a tutorial, but the game is simple enough to touch feel your way through

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I saw the first playthrough on this game on YouTube, I allready knew it was too late : This game was going to imprison me.
Needless to say I was excited as hell when I received my Key for the beta (I was checking my Mailbox more than 10 times each day waiting desperatly for this ^^')
As a player that has spent more than 1000 hours on SSBMelee/Brawl, I always found shameful that there was no real equivalent on PC : Now i'm satisfied.
So I booted the game, tried each character, found my favorites, done tons of Arcade Mode (I would have loved trying the Online but sadly servers were down :-/ ) and i'm now ready to give my review.

Pros+ :
+Allready Well-Polished Gameplay
+Combat System inspired by SSB but not totally copied
+Lot of different Character each with special Attacks and with great Charisma
+Mostly balanced characters
+Lovely simple graphics, Toaster-Friendly then
+Character customization (hope it will be available without paying real money)
+Great soundtrack
+Extremely enjoyable with friends

Cons- :
-Please, don't make things buyable only with real money, you can maybe make them hard to unlock ?
-Still work to do on the gameplay
-More Weapons maybe ? (Only 1 character with an Axe, but maybe others are coming soon Idk )
-More Items maybe ? (Bomb,Weapon,Mine and Horn, maybe it's enough, maybe it's not enough Idk )
-More Gamemodes maybe ?
-Cons are too blurred because game is allready awesome

Well, I think that's it, I recommend strongly this game for every SSB lover or simply people who have good taste in games (And it's free for the moment !). Now, i'm only waiting for more content, looking forward for new updates, I can't wait to see how great the final product will be :D
Thanks BMG, you made a fantastic work !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For a beta game, this is extremely impressive, and I would like to say my overall opinions on this game are positive, however, being that it is in fact a beta game, the negatives I have to say will most likely be fixed and when they are I'll edit the review

Pros:
-Fantastic Color/overall feel
-Slick controls
-Interesting class skins
-Nice level-up system
-Amazingly fun multiplayer/coop
-Controller support
-Couch party support
-Usually completely unlaggy/good steady framerate

Cons:
-Recurring connection issues
-Significant microtransactions
-Reallly, really bad secondary game mode/mini games.
-One-dementional classes, all have a variation of 3 different items ex: (one has: spear, gun; two has: hammer, gun)
-Really bad AI
-Glitchy ranked level-up

Content: 5/10
Fun factor: 8.5/10

Overall: 7/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do you like Super Smash Bros?
Do you like constant action?
Do you like laughing at the misery of others?

If you have answered yes, or if your answers were yes to all of these, then you'll probably want to stop reading this, and download Brawlhalla.

(Seriously, get it! It's FREE. F-R-E-E. PHREE.)

It's very similar to SSB, or PlayStation All Stars, if you've played either game. The core mechanic is fighting in a small arena. One wrong move, and the only way is down.

The game features basic Player vs. Player, Player vs. CPU, and Player vs. Player vs. CPU, up to 8 players.

You also earn in-game currency to unlock different brawlers.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a labor or love. Reviews are overwhelmingly positive for a reason.
Utilizing similiar mechanics to Smash Bros. with some clever twists of its own, Brawlhalla shines as a competitive player's dream come true. There's more air time to be had here than Smash, luck plays much less of a role (there are no random stage events, no Donkey Kong hammers or Invincibility Stars or other such items either, which makes for a much more balanced competitive game), and weapons play has its own twist as well so there will be change ups in strategy and one's approach to play here. There will be aching hands, sweaty palms, epic moments high in the air, as well as far below the stage, but you can triple jump + upward attack + dodge your way back up. You can jump, air-dodge, jump, side-attack, jump, downward attack, upward attack, and air-dodge again all before hitting the ground. Plus, you can hang on walls even below the ledge and gain fresh jumps. Yes, there will be wall play as well so watch out for divebombers, because in Brawlhalla, chasing is definitely encouraged. It takes skill and timing, but juggling a particular character is rewarded with successively powerful hits and this turns out to be a very clever and satisfying mechanic.
Everything controls very well, the game feels just right, it moves at a frantic pace in Free For All mode and has all the excitement, adrenaline and joy of a good ol' Smash Bros. match. All move are pulled out with ease, response is right on and the game is superbly balanced. In ranked 1v1 matches online patience, skill and strategy will get you far. Knowing when to dodge, and when to use your heavy attacks is key, because these leave you open for counter attack. Use sparingly unless the time is right! It was quite a challenge to rise to Silver rank until I switched my style of play up from Smash to Brawlhalla.  Online matches are smooth and lag free at this stage save for the very rare mili-second sputter. I've only seen this a few times in 10+ hrs play thus far and even then wasn't an issue. Perhpas I've been lucky so far, but even online via DSL the game play is smooth and in time. Pure unadulturated awesomeness. Sign up for Beta now dudes and dudettes. This game is worth the wait.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I could write a long review detailing everything I like about this game, but I wont. This game has a huge SSB vibe going for it, but not without its own twists and mechanics that make it a loveable game rather than a direct and bland clone. Ide recommend this game to anyone who enjoy the Smash Brothers games and would love that fix on PC.

Note you dont need to pay for this game. Its in Closed beta at the moment but you can sign up on the site to be sent a beta invite after some time. It varies between people, but it never takes too long to get one.

The only thing I dislike about this game at the moment is the Mammoth Coins(In-game currency like Riot Point or Gems) are super overpriced. All characters are free and only cosmetics can be purchased, and normally ide have no problem supporting the devs and buying some coins, but these are super overpriced.

8.5/10 Do Recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

INTRODUCTION

This Review will include my Suggestions of what would make Brawhalla more fun and my Review for the game!

REVIEW

At begining this Game was hard to master- all the Combos, different Legends and different Maps, but the more I lost the more I wanted to win and thats how I kept playing. Conclusion- the more you play this game the more you understand and better you get. Brawlhalla has really good Ranked system, Im at Gold right now, but I am still trying to climb harder as it really pulls you in. People who love Cosmetics to show off wont be disapointed either as this game has plenty of various Legend skins, Taunts, Weapon skins and even Companions. Devs are really great too- they keep fixing bugs and balancing the game making it even more enjoyable every time new Patch releases (sometimes with new Legends or Maps too) keeping in mind that Game is not fully released and can be annoying some times.
OVERALL: 9/10 If you are Hungry 2D Brawler Fan this Game is definetly for you!

SUGGESTIONS

I really hope Devs catch on to this one :P. Basically down bellow will be a list of thing which could make Brawlhalla even more fun to play. I will keep adding more ideas and deleting ones which were adeed. Please comment below and I might add your Idea in. Lets make this popular so Devs can improve the game just the way We want it to be! Thank You!

THESE ARE:

- Random Cosmetic Drops: Instead of this Cosmetic System I would personaly make it simillar to games like Dota 2, CS GO and TF 2. Where people would get random skins with different rarities including Chests with Keys to open them (or Cases) They could remake it so you can get headwear, bracelets, shoes etc. seperatly. And people could Trade and Sell items on the Steam, which brings us up to the next point.
- Steam Economy: Devs would earn way more money buy letting palyers sell their skins and Cosmetics.
- Harder to earn Money: I already got almost all champions! Please lower gold income just a little bit.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ergh. Bahk! Ermahgerd. Between the mixed emotions of unrivaled superiority and fit-inducing rage I am feeling towards my roommates as a result of this game, I've managed a few breaths to write this review.

As a seeming homage to SSB, this platform brawler delivers lots of wonderful couch-seated gamepad-smashing fun. There are functional online modes with free-for-all 4-player and a ranked 1v1. I never experienced any lag being in New England (close enough to Atlanta, GA I guess). Certainly more servers will arise as people get their hands on this one.

Many mechanics are similar to your favorite brawler, SSB, but with some tweaks. The weapons system gives each character their specific weapons and there are fewer items overall. The simplified approach makes weapons worth having in the game and actually worth picking up. It also makes the game much cleaner and quicker with more overall focus towards play style.

The brawlball and bombsketball game modes offer an excellent change of pace if you (for some alien reason) get tired of  beating on your friends all day.

Get some friends, get some gamepads, a big TV, your favorite chips and soda and go to town. Even laptop to TV is fine, I'm running no problems on my 2010 macbook pro.

Brawhalla is FTP, which is completely ridiculous to me. I would have paid $5 for this. Probably $10 or $15. The in-game purchases are entirely superficial as only skins for your favorite characters or weapons. So, w/e. ignore them if you must. but once you realize how great this game is, spend some money on something and tip your hat to the Devs. After I get some  more practce in, you may find me as Ada or Hattori, probably with an added skin.

Now stop reading and start brawling!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Speed it up, add wavedashing and rename it Meleehalla.

People say it is like Smash Bros, my opinion is it closer to Smash Bros Brawl (The slowest game in the series).

Pros:
+ Good Smash Bros style battles, though the rest of the game isn't like Smash Bros (Blasting your friends and rivals out of the stage).
+ Controller support.
+ Good multiplayer (Both online and local multiplayer).
+ Online 1v1.
+ Different modes (Time, stock, etc.).
+ Possible to disable items (Good for competetive play).
+ Can fight during the queue against the AI

Cons:
- Slow queue.
- Slow paced liked Smash Bros Brawl.
- Multiplayer lags a bit at the start of a battle.

8/10, it is like Smash Bros Brawl but much, much better (Brawl is the worst Smash Bros game, Melee being the best)!

Star rating (Out of 5): ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ

DISCLAIMER: I may change this review minorly or majorly once Brawlhalla is fully released!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do you like Super Smash Bros?
Do you like constant action?
Do you like laughing at the misery of others?

If you have answered yes, or if your answers were yes to all of these, then you'll probably want to stop reading this, and download Brawlhalla.

(Seriously, get it! It's FREE. F-R-E-E. PHREE.)

It's very similar to SSB, or PlayStation All Stars, if you've played either game. The core mechanic is fighting in a small arena. One wrong move, and the only way is down.

The game features basic Player vs. Player, Player vs. CPU, and Player vs. Player vs. CPU, up to 8 players.

You also earn in-game currency to unlock different brawlers.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For a beta game, this is extremely impressive, and I would like to say my overall opinions on this game are positive, however, being that it is in fact a beta game, the negatives I have to say will most likely be fixed and when they are I'll edit the review

Pros:
-Fantastic Color/overall feel
-Slick controls
-Interesting class skins
-Nice level-up system
-Amazingly fun multiplayer/coop
-Controller support
-Couch party support
-Usually completely unlaggy/good steady framerate

Cons:
-Recurring connection issues
-Significant microtransactions
-Reallly, really bad secondary game mode/mini games.
-One-dementional classes, all have a variation of 3 different items ex: (one has: spear, gun; two has: hammer, gun)
-Really bad AI
-Glitchy ranked level-up

Content: 5/10
Fun factor: 8.5/10

Overall: 7/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Really Gnarly Game!!!

This game is not even joking one of my main go to games right now. It is so well done and honestly addicting!

Pros
-Ranked games in solo and in 2v2
-Different characters
-Really nice community thats growing
-Addicting never getting old formet
-Matchmaking is a breeze
-Simple enough for you to get it fast, hard enough to take a while to master
-Very nice side sounds like the announcer
-No pay to win feature
-Alright amount of gamemodes
-Stunning graphics go amazing with the game
-Customizability to each and every chacter in not only apperance but strenghts and weaknesses

Of course though this game is not perfect. There are obviously reasons for this. THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS GAME! DO NOT EXPECT A COMPLETE VERSION ECSPECIALLY SINCE THE GAME IS FREE (Not to say the game feels like an FPS)

Cons
-In order to get a lot of the nice customizability you have to pay. This isnt really an issue but would be nice if there were somehow a way to get them without paying even if it meant a lot of grinding since it would add another goal!
-There aren't a lot of characters in the game so would be nice if we could get some cool ones!
-There are also not too many items at all to be picked up and used. It would be nice to see mush mush more items to be used on the battle besides mines, bombs, and spike balls.
-More map varity would be absolutely amazing! (Touched on more in Suggestions From Community)
-Ranked battles dont seem to hold any affect on a player
-Bots in the sport minigames are not very reliable ever at all lol

Like any game under development still they like other games should take suggestions (Which Bralhalla seems to do quite often anyways)

Suggestions From The Community
-Adding more varied maps seems to be like a solid feature. Maybe a map that changes terrain every once in a while or a map that increasingly gets smaller, even bigger elaborate maps would be cool to have along with the smaller ones!
-Adding more items in battle would make the game ever more interesting. Things like a long range gun with few bullets or a really hard hitting weapon that doesnt last vary long, short boosts that increase speed, hit speed, damage, defense, etc would be cool too. A super move as well kind of like the final smash in you guessed it Super Smash Bros Brawl is probably my biggest request though in this catagory.
-Adding a point to Ranked battles would make the game even more important!! Trust me on this!! More people would be willing to dedicate time and effort to Ranked Matches so therefore Brawlhalla if winning a certain number of matches granted you a certain prize. The best idea I could think of is seasons. Every once in a while there will be short seasons. Depending on where you place at the end of each season (Bronze, Silver, Gold Platinum and the number) you would get a rarer random mystery item(s). The items can range from skins to taunts to money to XP to even Mamoth Coins!
-More Minigames would also be a blast and just make this game more enjoyable to play ecspecially with friends. Bombsketball and the football gamemodes are an absolute blast and same for win based on kills and stock mode. Adding things like survival where you need to fend off against powerful bots each round and you prograssively get certain stat boosts, heling aid, etc. Another crazy  gamemode would be where each round or every few mins or seconds you get a character change, stat changes, ETC.

All in all this game really is just superb. Most of my cons werent even fair because this is an early access game. (Updates still happen!!) So play it!!! You wont regret it and if you somehow dont like it... no damage done!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nBrawlhalla is a brawler game heavily inspired by Super Smash Bros, meaning to kill your enemy is to knock them off the map. The game has less mechanics than ssb so it makes the game much easier to learn. The game is very relient on observing the attack/dodge pattern of your enemy, putting the pressure on you enemy, and pure instinct. With my experience in online gameplay, there is barely any lag. This game is smooth yo. The community of the game is small but very inviting and friendly. I absolutely love this game. Trust me you don't need to pay to play closed beta. A key is so easy to get, just ask Raidhyn!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Brawlhalla is similar to games like Super Smash Bros, Awesomenauts, Etc.

The overall concept of the game is excellent.  It removes a little of the casual feel of other games in it's genre, and I believe it will appeal to more technical gamers.

The characters are all available to play right now while it is in beta, but they will be purchasable with in-game earned gold upon release (I believe), similar to the way you'd buy champions in LoL, Dirty Bomb, and loads of other free to play games.

The characters themselves are pretty cool.  The art style is simple, effective, and in my opinion, beautiful.  Each one has a unique moveset and has 2 weapon pick-ups available for it.  The attacks feel clean and the hitboxes make sense, the dodge cooldown seems perfect to me and longer, skilled fights will make you break out in a sweat.

A few awesome modes, slight character customization, and a very solid 1v1 ranked system are all just toppings on an already delicious cake.

10/10 definitely recommend for any brawler fan.

Brawlhalla is a fine game.  It has a small handful of issues, but most of them are pretty minor and not worth mentioning.  The only one that I feel like actually talking about is how similar the characters are.  One charatcer with a gun weapon feels almost identical to another character with a gun weapon, however this issue isn't really to big anymore, since they've been adding more unique moves to each character.

If you want a good 2D brawler, I would highly recommend this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game... what shall i say about it. 1. IT IS AN EARLY ACCES AND I WILL TREAT IT AS SUCH! Meaning.. i will expect some small problems, but at the same time the amount of polishing I think games should have at beta stage.

Well.. first of all. I did not expect it to be this amazingly fun and addicting.

Graphics: (8/10 compared to other 2d cartoonish games)I always like 2d as much as 3d but from the screenshots and some of the weaker video's of the game it looked as if it was a bit to rough and pixely. However after playing it for a while i can honestly say... it fits the game.

The graphics are very smooth, no weird pixelated stuff, high quality backgrounds and overall it looks good.
There are no graphical options at all except for fullscreen/windowed. However with these graphics and good optimisation... this isnt any problem at all for nowadays microwaves. Ow.. did i say microwaves.. i mean ofcourse.. low-end pc's" :D

Options: (7/10)For this game there aren't to much options needed and to be fully honest... the game does not need more options. However as i do objective reviews i will have to compare it to the optionmenu's of similar games. Subjectively they don't need more options. Objectively other games do have resolution options etc.

Things it has atm: windowed/fullscreen setting
recommended:
a place to see the controlscheme being used (it detects what you use and tells you what controls it has .. for keyboard it even has 2 presets you can adjust)

Controls: (8/10)I use a PS4 controller (did also try both xbox360 and keyboard/keyboard+mouse). Controller is very easy to get used to... characters respond very fast to commands and the buttons make sense. keyboard as in any other fighter game.. takes getting used to for sure.
Unlike some other games its far from unplayable and ive seen people who actually got better when they started using their keyboard when their controller ran out of battery
hoursPlayed:
but i still prefer the feel of a controller.

1 thing i do not fully understand in the default attack direction. When you use a soft or heavy attack without pressing any direction it takes the UP direction as default. I would vote for using right/left (where you are looking at that time) as default attack direction.

Performance: (9.5/10)Almost requires nothing.. played it on a pc without any gpu at all and it still worked amazingly well even with the pc using a built-in graphics chipset that barely plays youtube at times XD Ofcourse there isnt TO much to render anyway ;D
-0.5 for a lack of framerate cap option :D

Now the most important part... gameplay: (9/10)Alot of people compare this to Super Smash Brothers.. and well... they would be correct.
The aircombat is slightly slower
voteText: but aside from that it does feel alot like the great brawlers we all know from the peasant  console race ( dem references)\n\nThere are as of now (Early Acces) a good amount of gameplay options ranging from local co-op
helpfulPercent: custom games with friends
votesHelpful: online games
votesTotal: singleplayer bot tournaments and ofcourse ranked 1v1. With custom games you have some nice stuff to tweak ranging from teambattles to ffa
votesFunny: pointlimits
commentsCount: timelimits
column16: damage%'s and more.\nAlso a practise mode that allows you to practise stuff with hitboxes
column17: damageboxes
column18:
damagenumbers etc. all available.

There are a good amount of legends (aka classes aka heroes aka characters) available. All these legends have a different combination of weapons they can carry/pick up and all have different heavy hit movesets. They also differ in stats so they all have their own strenghts and weaknesses. Atm you xcan customise your characters with 2 things...

1. stances (these can only be used in custom games.. NOT in ranked or online yet.. ) .. these stances all take away/give points to certain stats meaning you can give a legend more speed while taking away damage etc. etc.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a review for the game for as it is now in its beta version. I do recommend this game for anyone who likes fast paced brawlers, if you are a fan of the Super Smash Bros franchise (is it a franchise or would it be considered like a series or something? whatever it doesnt matter) you would certainly love this game. I personally believe that if more is added to this game such as more legends(characters), gamemodes, weapons, gadgets, etc. This game could become as good as, if not better then super smash bros.
I give this game a 6-7/10 as it is now but im sure if more is added than that score will increase.

Major pros
Fast paced smash bros like combat with less accidental knocking yourself off the edge due to a more useful recovery.
different weapons to change up your combat style mid-round.
leveling system on your profile and each individual character so you feel like your making progress
Online and local play so u can play with people across the world or in the same room

Major cons
Each character is about the same with only the unique combination of 2 weapons to really change there playstyle
leveling system is bland without any major upgrades
Poor bot AI making single player not really worth it

im sure there are other things that i forgot to mention but oh well.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game... what shall i say about it. 1. IT IS AN EARLY ACCES AND I WILL TREAT IT AS SUCH! Meaning.. i will expect some small problems, but at the same time the amount of polishing I think games should have at beta stage.

Well.. first of all. I did not expect it to be this amazingly fun and addicting.

Graphics: (8/10 compared to other 2d cartoonish games)I always like 2d as much as 3d but from the screenshots and some of the weaker video's of the game it looked as if it was a bit to rough and pixely. However after playing it for a while i can honestly say... it fits the game.

The graphics are very smooth, no weird pixelated stuff, high quality backgrounds and overall it looks good.
There are no graphical options at all except for fullscreen/windowed. However with these graphics and good optimisation... this isnt any problem at all for nowadays microwaves. Ow.. did i say microwaves.. i mean ofcourse.. low-end pc's" :D

Options: (7/10)For this game there aren't to much options needed and to be fully honest... the game does not need more options. However as i do objective reviews i will have to compare it to the optionmenu's of similar games. Subjectively they don't need more options. Objectively other games do have resolution options etc.

Things it has atm: windowed/fullscreen setting
recommended:
a place to see the controlscheme being used (it detects what you use and tells you what controls it has .. for keyboard it even has 2 presets you can adjust)

Controls: (8/10)I use a PS4 controller (did also try both xbox360 and keyboard/keyboard+mouse). Controller is very easy to get used to... characters respond very fast to commands and the buttons make sense. keyboard as in any other fighter game.. takes getting used to for sure.
Unlike some other games its far from unplayable and ive seen people who actually got better when they started using their keyboard when their controller ran out of battery
hoursPlayed:
but i still prefer the feel of a controller.

1 thing i do not fully understand in the default attack direction. When you use a soft or heavy attack without pressing any direction it takes the UP direction as default. I would vote for using right/left (where you are looking at that time) as default attack direction.

Performance: (9.5/10)Almost requires nothing.. played it on a pc without any gpu at all and it still worked amazingly well even with the pc using a built-in graphics chipset that barely plays youtube at times XD Ofcourse there isnt TO much to render anyway ;D
-0.5 for a lack of framerate cap option :D

Now the most important part... gameplay: (9/10)Alot of people compare this to Super Smash Brothers.. and well... they would be correct.
The aircombat is slightly slower
voteText: but aside from that it does feel alot like the great brawlers we all know from the peasant  console race ( dem references)\n\nThere are as of now (Early Acces) a good amount of gameplay options ranging from local co-op

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Really Gnarly Game!!!

This game is not even joking one of my main go to games right now. It is so well done and honestly addicting!

Pros
-Ranked games in solo and in 2v2
-Different characters
-Really nice community thats growing
-Addicting never getting old formet
-Matchmaking is a breeze
-Simple enough for you to get it fast, hard enough to take a while to master
-Very nice side sounds like the announcer
-No pay to win feature
-Alright amount of gamemodes
-Stunning graphics go amazing with the game
-Customizability to each and every chacter in not only apperance but strenghts and weaknesses

Of course though this game is not perfect. There are obviously reasons for this. THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS GAME! DO NOT EXPECT A COMPLETE VERSION ECSPECIALLY SINCE THE GAME IS FREE (Not to say the game feels like an FPS)

Cons
-In order to get a lot of the nice customizability you have to pay. This isnt really an issue but would be nice if there were somehow a way to get them without paying even if it meant a lot of grinding since it would add another goal!
-There aren't a lot of characters in the game so would be nice if we could get some cool ones!
-There are also not too many items at all to be picked up and used. It would be nice to see mush mush more items to be used on the battle besides mines, bombs, and spike balls.
-More map varity would be absolutely amazing! (Touched on more in Suggestions From Community)
-Ranked battles dont seem to hold any affect on a player
-Bots in the sport minigames are not very reliable ever at all lol

Like any game under development still they like other games should take suggestions (Which Bralhalla seems to do quite often anyways)

Suggestions From The Community
-Adding more varied maps seems to be like a solid feature. Maybe a map that changes terrain every once in a while or a map that increasingly gets smaller, even bigger elaborate maps would be cool to have along with the smaller ones!
-Adding more items in battle would make the game ever more interesting. Things like a long range gun with few bullets or a really hard hitting weapon that doesnt last vary long, short boosts that increase speed, hit speed, damage, defense, etc would be cool too. A super move as well kind of like the final smash in you guessed it Super Smash Bros Brawl is probably my biggest request though in this catagory.
-Adding a point to Ranked battles would make the game even more important!! Trust me on this!! More people would be willing to dedicate time and effort to Ranked Matches so therefore Brawlhalla if winning a certain number of matches granted you a certain prize. The best idea I could think of is seasons. Every once in a while there will be short seasons. Depending on where you place at the end of each season (Bronze, Silver, Gold Platinum and the number) you would get a rarer random mystery item(s). The items can range from skins to taunts to money to XP to even Mamoth Coins!
-More Minigames would also be a blast and just make this game more enjoyable to play ecspecially with friends. Bombsketball and the football gamemodes are an absolute blast and same for win based on kills and stock mode. Adding things like survival where you need to fend off against powerful bots each round and you prograssively get certain stat boosts, heling aid, etc. Another crazy  gamemode would be where each round or every few mins or seconds you get a character change, stat changes, ETC.

All in all this game really is just superb. Most of my cons werent even fair because this is an early access game. (Updates still happen!!) So play it!!! You wont regret it and if you somehow dont like it... no damage done!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI enjoy the concept of this game although i would like to see a non ranked  1v1. Also I think some balancing is overdue on the following weapons Lance,Hammers, and Guns. And a few legends need nerf on there attacks. Such as teros where he is  high in defense but also able to shell out tons of damage with attacks that arent slow enough for the amount of damage they deal. I feel his attacks should be just a bit slower in order for legends with high defense and high damage to have a more balanced feel. Id also like to see something like a unique passive with each legend or legend types . If this was done id feel like there would be a more skill based legend selection rather then just based on what weapon type i wanna abuse. And the addition of some conter play to legends would be nice too. Like giving weak spots to specific legends or weapon types. Other then those minor flaws I overall enjoy the game and its really fun to play with freinds and so far the community seems pretty nice. I can whole heartedly say i recommend this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Brawlhalla is a very fun game that is very similar to super smash bros. To me this is the only game that you would find enjoyable then any other brawller out thier. And also its F2P! And its very very fun. Also the game has alot of competition. This game may already be considered in the esports industry, as it has ranked, all characters are prefectly balanced, and requires a great amount of skill if someone wanted to be a pro in this game as thier is many playstyles and strategy. Also This game has community tournaments on ESL and have cash prize ones on reddit that gives out a fair amount of money if won.

Prize pools are around  200 - 1500$
however this increases as the game progresses. And basically since its open beta this game is going to get very big one day with an ever expanding amount of characters to actually choose from. What would make this game different from smash bros is how this game will constantly come out with characters and weopons for you to choose from. Also this game alllows you to buy skins for your characters to make them look good!. Also the community is really friendly and willing to help other players get better at the game. Out of all games i played to mobas, rts, and mmo and i still find this game less of a pain and its very enjoyable to play. espicially with custom lobbys to play with friends on.  Also the developers stream on twitch and many expirienced players do also. Also thier are crews that are really cool if you get into the competitive side.
I feel as if this game willl become a noticible esport in the future.

THANKS BMG FOR MAKING SUCH A GREAT GAME!
10/10

Buy this and heres why:
The combat is simple
Keyboard:
z - shield or imunity or call it zhonias if you play league
x - atack
c - Pick/throw stuff or diferent tipe of atack
v - throw your weapons
arrows move

The items that drop are bombs, mines, or weapons.
Each diferent character has diferent set of weapons so there are characters with one weapon in comun BUT the way they use the weapon is aways very diferent.

1 - the combat rapidness, and the outplay potencials are limitless.
2 - it only lags for those ho have bad internet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Speed it up, add wavedashing and rename it Meleehalla.

People say it is like Smash Bros, my opinion is it closer to Smash Bros Brawl (The slowest game in the series).

Pros:
+ Good Smash Bros style battles, though the rest of the game isn't like Smash Bros (Blasting your friends and rivals out of the stage).
+ Controller support.
+ Good multiplayer (Both online and local multiplayer).
+ Online 1v1.
+ Different modes (Time, stock, etc.).
+ Possible to disable items (Good for competetive play).
+ Can fight during the queue against the AI

Cons:
- Slow queue.
- Slow paced liked Smash Bros Brawl.
- Multiplayer lags a bit at the start of a battle.

8/10, it is like Smash Bros Brawl but much, much better (Brawl is the worst Smash Bros game, Melee being the best)!

Star rating (Out of 5): ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ

DISCLAIMER: I may change this review minorly or majorly once Brawlhalla is fully released!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an incredibly addicting game, much like smash brothers.

Pro:
-for competitive players, stages are well balanced. No one particular section will give you an overwhelming advantage/disadvantage due to the super floaty aerial system. (See cons for the flip side)
-stage appearances aren't overly complicated, so you are less likely to lose track of characters (theres a con to this)
-the controls and mechanics of the game are very easy for beginners to pick up and very familiar to those of us who have played smash brothers series.
-music is decent. At least good enough to where you don't feel the need to mute your sound.

con:
-although the aerial system compliments the simplistic stage designs, it's precisely this mechanic that makes combat momentum very sluggish.
-Concerning combat, considering this game goes out of it's way to mimic smash in as many ways as possible, it lacks quite a few attack variations. Having no difference in movement speeds also contributes to this factor.
-Another issue with combat and the lack of attack variations is the fact that the attacks you unleash in regards to directional input make little to no sense. (ex. Directional attacks don't match most cases. Push down to attack, you'll actually jump up and do something completely different. Something you'd expect from pushing up or maybe even jumping and pushing sideways. If the game had that many attack options that is.)
-Legends although they appear unique, often just turn out to be little more than different skins of other Legends.
- A glaring problem: For the legends who are unique, the characters you have to unlock or pay for are incredibly unbalanced compared to your starter characters. Their weapon related attacks having much larger and longer lasting hitboxes and often are 2 or 3x as effective. Some attacks from these particular Legend weapons I would go as far to say they auto combo. Once you intitiate the attack, the game does all the work for you. Hits a person multiple times, launches them into a dangerous position, then finishes the attack off with a spike.

To sum this up. Fun and addicting game, best played with friends and not competitively due to lazy combat system and unbalanced characters.


-Edit: Characters available to be used appear to be changed weekly maybe? So in the end, every character needs to be unlocked for daily use. In regards to balance without going into specifics. Some characters are just plain overpowered when it comes to their particular weapons and attacks. As a result, the most casual of players can win by hitting a single button repeatedly.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, I have been proven wrong before when I have enjoyed a game in Beta, but I really hope this goes through into actual full release.
When people say it is like Smash they are right. When thy say it is a Smash clone, they couldn't be any more wrong.

The basic set up is very Smash-esque but the play is a style in its own right. You play on a 2D stage with minor elements of hazzard such as pit falls and smashing an opponent off the stage which is all very Smash like.
But where it comes into its own is its style of combat. You all start off bar fistedwhich all have the same move set of a straight knuckle, upper and sweep to knock an opponent off.
But each character has two sets of weapons which you obtain randomly from pick ups in on the stage, a good few seem they are cloned but most have their own unique combat style and flare, making no two the exact same to play as. You also play with low gravity and a lot of moves capable of keeping you air born, making for some cool air born fights and juggles. Even when it seems to be over when you are falling to your death, you can make an epic come back when you use the right moves from the edge of the stage.

The combat style is what I love the most though about the game. It is all fast, all go with no time to rest, yet it flows really nice and keeps you excited, even if you are losing you are still just enjoying the rush and pace.

To top off, each character has their own bio and are quite unique in the looks department and varied. There is quite a selection already and can't wait to see what other characters they release and what new weapons they include.

All in all if you like Smash, Get it! If you like a decent and developing fighting experience with quirky characters, Get it! If you just want a game to let off steam on or just enjoy PvP, Get it!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game, But needs a TON more work done on it before it's a title worth spending any money on. (Though the devs look like they will be delivering that ton more content it needs.)

For those complaining about the online being hard it's because people playing this game on the PC are not used to brawlers or the strategy involved in them.(Not many brawler type games for the PC, even fewer have online gameplay.)

One good tip is when one guy has 9 points and the rest of the team is averaging around 2 then they need to work together to get the points balanced again.

Otherwise the guy with 9 point just has to get hit once by the lowest scorer and accidentally" fall off the map whenever his damage is high to keep anyone else from getting anywhere near him score wise. (Easy win for anyone who actually read this.)

There are many other tips and tricks assosiated with games exactly like this. But I'm too lazy to list em all.
Just use your heads people. (Something that pc gamers have been doing allot less of since game capable computers have become easily affordable for the generall public. Lets not end up like console online gaming.)

I wrote this review in hopes that I can inspire better tactics in the player base.... it's way to easy to win at the moment and it makes the game dull.

Review cap

Highest scorer= Biggest threat.
and
Feeding the weakest player when damage is high= Easy wins."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

INTRODUCTION

This Review will include my Suggestions of what would make Brawhalla more fun and my Review for the game!

REVIEW

At begining this Game was hard to master- all the Combos, different Legends and different Maps, but the more I lost the more I wanted to win and thats how I kept playing. Conclusion- the more you play this game the more you understand and better you get. Brawlhalla has really good Ranked system, Im at Gold right now, but I am still trying to climb harder as it really pulls you in. People who love Cosmetics to show off wont be disapointed either as this game has plenty of various Legend skins, Taunts, Weapon skins and even Companions. Devs are really great too- they keep fixing bugs and balancing the game making it even more enjoyable every time new Patch releases (sometimes with new Legends or Maps too) keeping in mind that Game is not fully released and can be annoying some times.
OVERALL: 9/10 If you are Hungry 2D Brawler Fan this Game is definetly for you!

SUGGESTIONS

I really hope Devs catch on to this one :P. Basically down bellow will be a list of thing which could make Brawlhalla even more fun to play. I will keep adding more ideas and deleting ones which were adeed. Please comment below and I might add your Idea in. Lets make this popular so Devs can improve the game just the way We want it to be! Thank You!

THESE ARE:

- Random Cosmetic Drops: Instead of this Cosmetic System I would personaly make it simillar to games like Dota 2, CS GO and TF 2. Where people would get random skins with different rarities including Chests with Keys to open them (or Cases) They could remake it so you can get headwear, bracelets, shoes etc. seperatly. And people could Trade and Sell items on the Steam, which brings us up to the next point.
- Steam Economy: Devs would earn way more money buy letting palyers sell their skins and Cosmetics.
- Harder to earn Money: I already got almost all champions! Please lower gold income just a little bit.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You craving for smash brawl kinda game, but you only own PC ?
Rest assured, since there's an alternative for that, and it's called Brawlhalla, folks !
It's still in early access but, heck, you could get a lot of fun from this and it's free too !
So, on to the review.

+ Not Pay 2 Win, you could unlock all characters by just... playing a lot. What is cash for then ? Vanity items. Makes
you a lot cooler but don't affect the gameplay at all. And the default characters ? Don't worry, since there's a lot to choose from and they're not weak compared to the paid characters at all.
+ A lot of legendaries, it's the term for the characters in this game. Yeah, there's a lot of characters and each one have their own unique playstyles.
+ Requires timing and skills, it's not just your ordinary button spamming game folks. Timing is required here, so it could be counted as competitive fighting game.
+ The BGM sounds really catchy and fits the game.
+ and, again. It's FREE, folks !

So that's it ! Now for the people who craves to brawls, what are you waiting for ? Try it ASAP !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A cool brawler game similar to Smash Brothers, has a character system similar to League of Legends where you have a constantly changing free roster and pay for the others. Rounds are fast with a good amount of action.

It misses some semi-important features but overall a pretty solid game!
I spend the first 2-3 minutes searching for a tutorial mode which I did not end up finding. It would be nice for a tutorial mode to be present that at least explains the characters.

I was personally dissapointed to see that the fighters are locked away in a system similar to League of Legends, but that is a personal thing of mine. I also am quite skeptical about paid transactions (like skins) in an early access game but since this game is free to play and has enough content I do not think of it as a negative factor.

After having spent some time looking at the menu I played some single player against bots, a few normal games and a average amount of 1v1 ranked games and once a 2v2 ranked game with a friend of mine. The bots in the single player mode helped me understand the game almost instantly along with a few of its characters.

Playing normal games is pointless if you are forced to play time mode. It turned me instantly away from normal games to playing ranked since ranked games are based on lives: a game rule I personally enjoy over time-based rounds. It is pretty obvious it is planned for normal games (and maybe ranked games) to have all the modes the game will offer during and after the beta but I do think it should be mentioned nontheless.

After all, I think the game is pretty solid so far and I hope it will be updated with some awesome features. Some cool quality of life changes would be being able to use steam to invite players into your game/custom room/whatever is applicable, a tutorial mode, the ability to see some kind of number of damage players have taken in their lives instead of just a colour and enabling life mode (and more modes as they are being added) on normal games and possibly ranked games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Truly F2P, no P2W, the All Legends pack seems like a very fair deal which I plan on getting in on soonish.
Online FFA is a massive cluster‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• which I am not a fan of, and this mode also doesn't seem to use a hidden ELO like it would in many other games, all FFA games I've played (at least 1 every day for the daily quest) had 1 or 2 players who win by a 5+ point margin, and at least 1 guy who got absolutely stomped- it's not great. Nevertheless, it's there and there are a multitude of other modes, including local play, but I guess you can read all of that on the storepage. I came here for the 1v1 so I did not get disappointed (except with my own ability).

As a side-note, I did really enjoy playing the seasonal mode (snowbrawl? whatever it was called) and other fun-modes with friends, good stuff, hope to see more of that.

The only thing that didn't seem to work ideally was lobbies, having to give your friend the number of the private lobby works, but it's kinda unusual for games nowadays, and we got DC'ed every second game playing in private lobbies, not sure what that's about.

All in all, great stuff, especially as F2P. Yes!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Were you a big fan of the Super Smash series?
You don't have a Nintendo console anymore?
Well, this is the game for you buddy. It's free to play and absolutely not pay to win, only things you can really spend some of that money on is cosmetics or the ability to play some of your favorite legends whenever you want. It's reasonably small and easy to install and start playing with friends. You can start private lobbys, practice offline with bots to see the exact damage and hitboxes or you can prove what you're worth by stepping into matchmaking. You can try out different game modes, the usual beat 'em up, or something like brawlball. The game features daily missions that are kind of cool, though not really diverse. They reward you with a bunch of in game coins and nothing more. The game is balanced for as far as I can see, and doesn't really have OP characters and or moves. The community of the game is reasonably big, but not huge obviously.

So to sum it all up, Pros:
-Amazing feel and artwork.
-Balanced enough.
-Good diversity for alot of playtime.
-FREE!
-Small and easy to install.
-Good community.
-Good fun with friends.
-Regularly updated and good interaction with the devs,

Cons:
-Lag in matchmaking can really screw up a game.
-Not really alot of diversity between characters.

Really don't have much bad to say about the game, but I will update this if I do.

In my honest opinion, this is a great game, and nothing else.
And it's free. So just play it already!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A cool brawler game similar to Smash Brothers, has a character system similar to League of Legends where you have a constantly changing free roster and pay for the others. Rounds are fast with a good amount of action.

It misses some semi-important features but overall a pretty solid game!
I spend the first 2-3 minutes searching for a tutorial mode which I did not end up finding. It would be nice for a tutorial mode to be present that at least explains the characters.

I was personally dissapointed to see that the fighters are locked away in a system similar to League of Legends, but that is a personal thing of mine. I also am quite skeptical about paid transactions (like skins) in an early access game but since this game is free to play and has enough content I do not think of it as a negative factor.

After having spent some time looking at the menu I played some single player against bots, a few normal games and a average amount of 1v1 ranked games and once a 2v2 ranked game with a friend of mine. The bots in the single player mode helped me understand the game almost instantly along with a few of its characters.

Playing normal games is pointless if you are forced to play time mode. It turned me instantly away from normal games to playing ranked since ranked games are based on lives: a game rule I personally enjoy over time-based rounds. It is pretty obvious it is planned for normal games (and maybe ranked games) to have all the modes the game will offer during and after the beta but I do think it should be mentioned nontheless.

After all, I think the game is pretty solid so far and I hope it will be updated with some awesome features. Some cool quality of life changes would be being able to use steam to invite players into your game/custom room/whatever is applicable, a tutorial mode, the ability to see some kind of number of damage players have taken in their lives instead of just a colour and enabling life mode (and more modes as they are being added) on normal games and possibly ranked games.
